results.title: House of Wax
results.brief_description: House of Wax was the first colour 3D feature film that incorporated stereo sround. So not only did action spring from the screen, but sound effects were also heard in different sections of the cinema, heightening the drama through the illusion of multi-directional audio.

constellations_primary.name: Movies on wax
constellations_primary.description: Waxing lyrical about the supernatural and early 21st-century teen stars.

constellations_other.name: New ways of seeing
constellations_other.description: The 3D worlds presented through the stereoscopic viewer are part of an ongoing fascination with immersive imagery.

results.description: In the original trailer for House of Wax (1953), Warner Brothers heralded the third dimension as “the new wonder of the entertainment world”. Though that wonder had been discovered a year earlier in Bwana Devil (1952), Warner Brothers explored immersion further by releasing a colour 3D feature that incorporated stereo sound for the first time. So not only did action spring from the screen, but sound effects were also heard in different sections of the cinema, heightening tension and drama through the illusion of multi-directional audio. Both of these innovations are standard in filmmaking today.

results.title: Hollow Knight
results.brief_description: Hollow Knight is an award-winning platforming game developed by Australian indie studio Team Cherry.

constellations_primary.name: Silent adventures (Hollow Knight - Education)
constellations_primary.description: Videogames, film and TV usually rely on the spoken word to communicate character and story. It wasn’t always this way. Although we may think of ‘silent films’ as in the past, there are contemporary videogames and films that shy away from using the spoken word.

constellations_other.name: [WEBBED] Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

results.description:
Hollow Knight is an award-winning platforming game developed by Australian indie studio Team Cherry.

Players explore vast underground catacombs of the ruined Hallownest kingdom. Much of the map is locked off to the player in the beginning but becomes accessible after the player finds key objects or gains new or enhanced skills.

Initially created through a successful Kickstarter campaign, Hollow Knight has playful animation, slick game mechanics and a unique gothic aesthetic that has seen it sell over a million copies worldwide.

results.title: Her Story
results.brief_description: Independently developed by Sam Barlow, Her Story uses live-action footage to follow a police interrogation and is influenced by the directing techniques of Alfred Hitchcock and the Dogme 95 school of filmmaking, as well as real-life interrogations and Sharon Stone’s performance in Basic Instinct (1992).

constellations_primary.name: Screen story searching
constellations_primary.description: Cinema, smartphones and sensuality collide in this intriguing Constellation that takes a distinctly different path.

constellations_other.name: Television and creative constraint
constellations_other.description: Making art for the screen is dependent on time, resources, and infrastructure. Where technology could have posed a barrier, these television producers saw an opportunity, instead.

results.description:
Hannah’s husband is missing and the police have questions.

Her Story follows Hannah’s interrogation and is an interactive full-motion video (FMV) narrative made up of seven police interviews, split into smaller clips viewed on a 1990s-style desktop. Players watch, interpret and dissect these interviews to discover the truth in the characters’ stories.

Independently developed by Sam Barlow, Her Story uses live-action footage instead of rendered character models and is influenced by the directing techniques of Alfred Hitchcock and the Dogme 95 school of filmmaking, as well as real-life interrogations and Sharon Stone’s performance in Basic Instinct (1992).

results.title: Headliner: NoviNews
results.brief_description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society.

constellations_primary.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_primary.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.description:
Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society. Players take the role of a ‘headliner’, which is like a chief editor at a news outlet. The player must decide what stories and angles to publish, and their choices have wide-reaching effects in the game world. Reject stories about creating national healthcare services? People get sick in the street. Approve stories on the benefits of synthetic recreational drugs? Addiction runs rampant.

These stories aren’t presented as obviously ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ choices: the game lets the player’s own ethics and morals guide their decisions – which can create a peaceful society or burn it to the ground.
